location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.
Foliation: the system in use appears in a circle in the top right corner of each folio. The documents in the file (excluding the notes at the end) are also numbered 1-4 inclusive (uncircled).

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the Adviser to the Bahrain Government (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave) to the Political Agent, Bahrain (Lieutenant Colonel Percy Gordon Loch) concerning the import duty on pearl buttons imported into the United Kingdom and India, 31 July 1933; and a letter from the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Director General of the Department of Commercial Intelligence and Statistics, Calcutta, India, sending samples of mother-of-pearl shells and oyster shells in response to a request for pearl shells from the Director of Fisheries, Madras, 19 February 1936, with accompanying memorandum from the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Adviser to the Bahrain Government, 19 February 1936.
